== '''Hirlam System Documentation''' ==
= ''' HIRLAM Model Domains ''' =
[[Center(end)]]

=== '''Definition of HIRLAM model domains''' ===

HIRLAM model is formulated on [https://hirlam.org/trac/wiki/HirlamSystemDocumentation/Configure/VerticalGrid hybrid coordinates in the vertical] and prepared for a general conformal horizontal coordinate system or map-projection. Rotated or un-rotated spherical coordinates in the horizontal have so far been used in HIRLAM operational and research community. The forecast system has been prepared to use spectral and/or semi-Lagrangian techniques. For physical parameterisation, it has been made more independent of the dynamic part and operates on subareas which consists of a number of grid-columns. The reference forecast model is formulated in grid-point space, whereas the model version in spectral representation exists (using earlier physics package). HIRLAM variational data assimilation has been formulated using spectral version of the HIRLAM system.

Following variables are needed to define a HIRLAM area,
{{{
NLON     # number of gridpoints in x-direction
NLAT     # number of gridpoints in y-direction
NLEV     # number of model full levels
SOUTH    # southern boundary in degrees
WEST     # western boundary in degrees
NORTH    # northern boundary in degrees
EAST     # eastern boundary in degrees
POLON    # longitude position of rotated south pole
POLAT    # latitude position of rotated south pole
}}}

Note that in the above, the chosen nlon must satisfy that nlon-2-2*npbpts being factors of 2, 3 and 5 for the Fourier transform routine used in the Helmholtz solver. npbpts in the expression is number of extra passive lines with full weight to the boundary fields, used in the semi-lagragian scheme in order to prevent the trajectories from going outside the integration area. npbpts is a fixed parameter for each model domain, Note the prime-factors listed above may be different for different computer platforms. e.g., in the ECMWF IBM HPCF, prime-factors of 7,11 are allowed.

In reference HIRLAM script, definitions for a number of commonly used model domains in HIRLAM operational and research communities are available in [https://hirlam.org/trac/browser/trunk/hirlam/scripts/Env_domain script Env_domain]. Selection of model domain among those pre-defined ones can be done in [https://hirlam.org/trac/browser/trunk/hirlam/scripts/Env_expdesc Env_expdesc] by selection of relevant domain names for variable '''DOMAIN'''.

=== '''HIRLAM Operational and Experimental Model Domains''' ===

The standard configuration of the reference HIRLAM, RCR-7.1, is currently run at FMI as main operational suite. In HIRLAM member services, different versions of HIRLAM model with local modifications are runn. Figure below show the Atlantic-scale operational domain in HIRLAM operational centers in mid-2007.
